lines.text: You scram, before I wrap a chair around your neck!

[Angrily]
It's three o'clock in the morning - where do you want me to go?
[Nan starts to speak, but Vivian immediately cuts her off]
You cheap stenographer...
Outside, countess. As long as they've got sidewalks YOU'VE got a job.
[Shoves her out, gives her a swift kick in the rump, and slams the door behind her]
Hello, Vivian. This is Miss Rich. My secretary, Miss Prescott.
I know Miss Bi... Rich, if you remember.
I wouldn't beef about being locked up with the man I love!
Sometimes I get the feeling you don't like anybody.
If you only knew.
Listen, Nan, send a new boy and girl on right away, and make sure they're not in love with each other.
Right.
Uh, get a couple already married.
Is there, is there anything I can do?
Yeah. See that window over there?
Yeah.
Take a running jump and I think you can make it.
Aw, talking pictures, it's just a fad.
You said you'd marry me and you're going to marry me!
Well, I sure know how to pick 'em.
You said it, Papa.
Maybe you should help me next time, huh?
What do you think I've been trying to do?

[to Vivian Rich]
I'd rather you sue me than marry me.
If I were a man, I wouldn't be a lapdog tied to any woman's apron strings.
I might surprise you.
You probably won't.
Where's Thompson?
Out for a few minutes.
He'll be out for life if he doesn't stick closer to business.
Nan, are you busy?
No, just dreaming lazily about life.
Chester, it's like being in jail.
Sorry, dear, better get used to it.
She is used to it.
I've got an idea.
Keep it to yourself or the wife'll cash in on it.
And when I get an idea I do something about it.
Most dames do.
